page.syntax: Common_List as C = word_in_common(C list1 ,C list2 [,C delimiter ])

argument.name: word_in_common
argument.description: The words found in both lists, separated by the delimiter string.

argument.name: list1
argument.description: A character string list of words.

argument.name: list2
argument.description: A character string list of words.

argument.name: delimiter
argument.description: Optional.Default = CR-LF. The character string that delimits words in each list.

page.description: Find the words in common between two lists of words. Default delimiter is CRLF.
page.discussion: Returns a list of words in common between List1 and List2. The words in List1 and List2 are separated by Delimiter. This function is typically used in Xbasic programs to find a list of CR-LF delimited words that two strings have in common.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following Xbasic script defines two lists of CR-LF-delimited words, then finds the common words.
section.example: list1 = red green yellow blue purple orange %a% list2 = red orange cyan %a% ? word_in_common(list1, list2, crlf() ) = "red orange" dim a as C = "one,two,three,four" dim b as C = "two,four" ? word_in_common(a, b, ",") = "two,four"
